reviews.review: Like resident evil with zombies
safe house is this way.
Hermoso.

Ein klassicher Zombieshooter der richtig Laune macht.Zwar ist das Spiel etwas älter und braucht keine solch große und teure Grafikkarte...(ganz im Gegenteil)... dennoch ist die Atmosphäre düster und gruselig und die Waffen bringen mit den recht guten Waffensounds Licht ins Dunkle.Was ich auch noch gut finde sind die verschiedenen Zombiearten. z.b. der Boomer oder der Hunter sind sehr gut konzipierte Zombies und man sollte auch Respekt vor den haben.Der Koopmodus ist ebenfalls sehr launisch und der Multiplayer erstrecht.Das Spiel ist JETZT noch ein Klassiker unter ALLEN Spielen und verdient deshalb 8/10 Punkten.Was ich außerdem mag sind die Wellen von Zombies =D Ich liebe es wie sie sich in Luft auflösen wenn man auf sie schiesst =D Wer Left 4 Dead 2 schon hat,braucht diesen Teil nicht haben,es sei denn er ist Fan der Reihe oder es ist Sale.Wer Left 4 Dead nicht kennt soll sich schämen =D

Huge zombie massacre with strong co-op focus. Join a team of four survivors to get out of hell. Enemies are easy to kill, but there are thousands of them. Look at it as a gamification of you favorite splatter film.

Single player campaign mode is a bit strange. There are consecutive campaigns with various chapters. Every chapter can be played at any time, and there's no way to save progress (it seems). Still you will enter the following chapter with health, weapons, etc. from the preceding one if you play them one after the other. If you want to complete a campaign, you'll have to play all of its chapters in a go.

Few weapons and explosives, unlimited ammo for the pistols and few enemy types suggest this will get boring soon. Loads of fans still playing this game suggest the opposite. Various multiplayer modes increase variety. In any case worth a try if you can get a good deal.

YES

Some years ago I ran a L4D clan.  After hundreds of hours, it all got a bit boring... but now a few years later I'm back on it, and finding it still holds its own against other online MP games of today, and better than even its own sequel.

Campaign mode follows the four survivors as hey battle towards escape, via helicopter, boat, whatever.  It's a lot of fun, especially in co-op with some good mates.  The game is made for speedruns, but manages to slow the pace at various "event" spots where you must stand off against hungry hordes of zombies.

The game comes into its own in versus mode.  Two teams of four take it in turns to play as the survivors, earning points for each % of the level they manage to cross before their doom.  Making it to the end of the level is an intense experience, for one reason - the other team play as the zombies!

Playing as the special infected requires its own skills, separate to the survivors'.  The attacking team must work together to create mayhem and kill off the humans.  A good team will coordinate attacks the AI couldn't dream of, and in turn the survivors must up their game to defend against the onslaught.

If you haven't played this game yet, it's not too late.  There are still active servers, and plenty of people to play against, although many of them seem to prefer L4D2 which, to be fair, does have all the levels from this game.

Got three friends?  Buy the four-pack and welcome to the best game of the last few years!
Just an all around awesome fast paced zombie killing game :P not quite like CoD, but the zombies on here are a bit more mental at least lol
Still fun after years and years!

This review is only for one specific type of PC gamer: the single player only gamer.  (Some of us prefer not to deal with other people when we are playing our games.)  If you only play single player, this game is not really fun.  While the team AI is better than some, developers still haven't perfected it.  The game feels pretty short, but I tend to want to explore a level to it's fullness on my first play through and not replay the level.  Each time the level feels different, but I'm still replaying the level.  If you have a good group of friends (or can find a good server), than I'm sure the game is pefrect for you.  If you intend to only play on single player, try out a different game.

Estamos en un mundo dominado por zombis, donde cuatro supervivientes deben salir vivos de la zona infectada, en diferentes mapas y contra diferentes variedades de infectados y seres repugnantes tendremos que luchar por conseguir la supervivencia.

El juego jugando con amigos es muy divertido y entretenido, es casi imposible jugar dos campañas iguales y el cooperativo online lo hacen un juego por el que cualquier jugador gozará las horas invertidas en el, no pararemos de disparar y matar, continuar, disparar y matar.

Utiliza el mismo motor que el Counter Strike, aunque le falta quizás mayor variedad de armas, hay bastantes pero no las suficientes, al final te cansas de utilizar siempre las mismas.

Los gráficos no son nada del otro mundo ni hacen falta pues cuando hordas y hordas vienen de cualquier vaya o rendija de una pared solo disfrutas de las cabezas que revientas y de tu victoria inminente junto a tus amigos

El sonido acompaña y es necesario pues es el único aviso de los infectados especiales, se podría quizás haber añadido mejores diálogos o una mejor trama, una historia mas contundente y que enganche, no nos engañemos, el juego es para jugarlo cooperativamente y si puede ser con otros tres amigos mejor.

La peor parte del juego quizás es que con las horas de juego se vuelve bastante repetitivo y deseas llegar a la parte final del juego, la cual se vuelve muy difícil y complicada, es insufrible vamos...

Lo recomiendo si lo vas a jugar con  amigos, de lo contrario ahórrate el dinero.

Classic. Own it and Play it 

Before L4D2, there was L4D. Boy was it a game changer, a different hoarde and enemy setup everytime you play? Wowza. This game had it all, and it still does. Even though it's sequel now has the original campaigns, it's not the same with the altered graphics, different combat and laodout mechanics and different enemies. Do a #TBT with your friends on this one, no one will complain.

uh huh

Possibly the greatest multiplayer I've ever experienced in an FPS game. Thoroughly enjoyed my 500+ hours of Left 4 Dead, every single second of it. 
 
Strategy, tactics, player skill and teamwork, all vital to a good game and all bringing their own set of challenges to overcome. One of my greatest games, ever :D

It's a little bit misleading that they offer Left 4 Dead and Left 4 Dead 2 as if they're both proper, 'full-length' entries in a series. Because, basically speaking, Left 4 Dead 2 is the full game. It includes all the content from Left 4 Dead 1 and more. Left 4 Dead 1 now feels like a half-finished product that has become almost completely obsolete with the release of L4D2.

And frankly, even when I judge Left 4 Dead 1 as a seperate game, I would not recommend it. Technically speaking, there is not much wrong with it. In fact, it's fairly well-made overall. However, the gameplay is so incredibly repetitive. Each of the 6 campaigns is set up in the same way and only lasts about 60-90 minutes. Within 5-10 hours, you will have seen everything the game has to offer (most of it 6 times over already) and all that's left to do is play online multiplayer matches. 

Online matches could have been lots of fun, but, in my experience, the online community is so unwelcoming, immature and hostile. It's much more likely you'll end up fighting with your teammates instead of making friends with them and having a good time together.

So my recommendation would have been that you only get this game if you already have some friends who are willing to play it with you. It would have been, because again, with the release of L4D2 there is almost no point getting L4D1 anymore. Save your money and only buy L4D2 if you're interested in these games.

I can't put it down and can't say no to it and that's why you should buy it.

This game was the kind of genre leap I was really looking for in First-Person Shooters (I find the trend towards corridor shooters in the past decade distressing). There's few other games out there which better emphasize team work. Even on the easiest difficulty setting, if you don't work with your team, you will die. The computer is competent if you have to play solo or without a full team, but playing with strangers is hit-or-miss, leaning heavily miss. Play with friends for best results.
